title: Ticket #6997: condor_q gives false errors when using the -attributes flag
description:
If condor_q is invoked with the -attributes command line flag in conjunction with -long, -json, or -xml flags, and the attributes ClusterId and ProcId are not both included, condor_q reports scary errors like 

   Error: Two results with the same ID

This is because condor_q code to assign jobs into collections really wants to see the job id attributes in order to sort the results by job id.

A simple, (but wrong) one line code fix would be to automatically add those two attributes to the list provided with the -attributes flag, but this will then result in these attributes showing up uninvited in the user's output.

Work-around for users running versions older than v8.8.3 is to add -stream-results flag, which will bypass the code that tries to sort ads by job id.

If sort of the ads is important, then they could use -af:r rather than -long

condor_q -af:lrng produces output that is the same as -long except that -af will not skip a missing attribute, but will always print something at that position.

An alternate work around is to add ClusterId and ProcId to the list of attributes provided with the -attributes flag, although this will also alter the output.
remarks:
The right fix here is to not try and sort the results when ClusterId and ProcId are not part of the projection. Or use the ad return order as a final sort key.

Perhaps, stream-results should be turned on automatically when the output is -long and the projection does not include cluster and proc.
. This is a bad idea, because it would potentially result in a connection being held to the schedd for a long time if the user pauses the output of condor_q somehow.

2019-May-13 15:50:11 by jfrey:
Code Review

This code looks good.
